## succeedsWithDetail() function

Returns [DetailedSuccess&lt;T, TD&gt;](./ts-utils.detailedsuccess.md) with a supplied value and optional detail.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function succeedsWithDetail<T, TD>(value: T, detail?: TD): DetailedSuccess<T, TD>;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

value


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The value of type `<T>` to be returned.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

detail


</td><td>

TD


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ An optional detail of type `<TD>` to be returned.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DetailedSuccess](./ts-utils.detailedsuccess.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, TD&gt;

A [DetailedSuccess&lt;T, TD&gt;](./ts-utils.detailedsuccess.md) with the supplied value and detail, if supplied.

## Remarks

The `succeedsWithDetail` alias was added in release 5.0 for naming consistency with [fails](./ts-utils.fails.md)<!-- -->, which was added to avoid conflicts with test frameworks and libraries.
